summary: Apple is exploring the use of generative artificial intelligence to help design its in-house chips, a senior executive says . Apple has relied on its custom silicon since 2010, beginning with the A4 chip .  Srouji, a key figure in Apple's custom chip transition, was once considered for a leadership role at Intel . Intel offered limited updates on its AI strategy during its June Worldwide Developers Conference .

NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang predicts spending on AI-enabled data centers will double to $2 trillion over the next four to five years . Wall Street analysts and investors are underestimating the potential of the AI economy .  Nobody wanted the first DGX-1 in 2016, except a little startup called OpenAI . NVIDIA has been in a unique position ever since . It was the mini supercomputer about the size of a college dorm fridge .  The Week in AI: The Reasoning Wars, Sam's Love Letter, Zuck's Land Grab . This week's episode is a replay of last Friday's episode of The Week In AI . With 25 links, you are guaranteed to find something that answers your top questions about the AI revolution .  Apple researchers found some limitations where the models "give up" on large problems without enough context . It's worth pondering if they are simply "token prediction" machines that eventually get wrapped around their own axles . I've experienced this with some of the "vibe-coding" tools like Replit and Bolt .  The new Veo 3 ad from a Los Angeles dentist is taking social media by storm . We'll talk about that in this Friday's X Friday's Space .  Anthropic co-founder Ben Mann says we'll know AI is transformative when it passes the "Economic Turing Test: Give an AI agent a job for a month. When they pick the hiring manager more often than not, we've crossed the threshold."  Sam Altman wrote a blog post titled "The Gentle Singularity" to highlight his optimism in the face of brewing storms . Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned us about the rapid disruption of work and its impacts on citizens and families . The best-case future is a "symbiosis between people and AI" where machines handle the mundane, and humans live more interesting lives .  In this way, AI can move quickly beyond issues of personal safety, to those of economic security . In the replay of The Week in AI, I discuss the implications of "post-labor economics" as well as share more expert resources on these topics .  Both Apple and Google are introducing heavyweight category wearables later this year . Scoble is looking forward to the next devices which should be coming in AR space .  Zuck splashes the pot with $14.3 billion for Meta PlatformsMETA . It's the biggest pure-AI acquisition, following OpenAI's $6 billion purchase of Jony Ive's company .  Scale AI is a San Francisco-based artificial intelligence company founded in 2016 . The company specializes in providing high-quality data labeling, annotation, and model evaluation services that are essential for training advanced AI models .  AMD CEO Lisa Su unveiled the Helios AI Rack-scale architecture supporting up to 72 MI400 GPUs, with 432GB of HBM4 memory per GPU and 19.6 TB/sec bandwidth . AMD reaffirmed its commitment to an annual cadence of AI chip releases .  Lisa welcomed the founder and CEO of OpenAI as a key design partner for AMD's upcoming MI450 GPU . Microsoft Azure runs proprietary and open-source models on AMD Instinct MI300X GPUs in production . Oracle Cloud Infrastructure will deploy zettascale AI clusters with up to 131,072 MI355X . Apple is exploring generative AIto accelerate its in-house chip design, potentially slashing development timelines and boosting productivity . Since debuting its first A4 chip in 2010, Apple has relied on cutting-edge EDA tools from Cadence Design Systems and Synopsys .  Investors should watch how quickly EDA providers roll out AI modules and whether Apple pilots internal machine-learning models for layout, verification or synthesis . Faster cycle times could give Apple an edge over rivals .

President Donald Trump is weighing a range of potential actions in response to a recent armed conflict between Israel and Iran, including a possible U.S. strike against Iran . The White House has previously said it won’t strike Iran .  President Trump will sign an executive order sparing TikTok from a law banning or forcing a sale of the social media platform . The U.S. Senate has passed a bill to set up the first regulatory framework for stablecoins .  Companies, advocates and investors in the psychedelic field are hopeful the Trump administration will support the space after favorable sentiments by several key officials . Publicly traded companies in the space include Bit Digital(BTBT), Bitfarms(BITF), Coinbase(COIN), Core Scientific(CORZ) and TeraWulf(WULF)  Texas Instruments announced its plans to invest more than $60B across seven U.S.semiconductorfabs . Combined, TI’s new manufacturing mega-sites in Texas and Utah will support more than 60,000 jobs . FDA Commissioner Marty Makary has made positive remarks on the opportunity the substances could hold for veterans .  SM1, Texas Instruments’ first new fab in Sherman will begin initial production this year, just three years after breaking ground . The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF invests in companies at the forefront of innovation . The fund offers targeted exposure to large-cap tech leaders, complemented by emerging AI disruptors . A 0.75% expense ratio is pricey, but could be worth it if the Ives strategy manages to outperform .  Dan Ives is a Managing Director and senior technology sector analyst at Wedbush Securities, one of the largest privately owned securities brokerages and asset managers in the U.S.  The ETF is passively managed, meaning it's not necessarily intended to beat the market . It provides targeted exposure to a thematic index based on a basket of stocks selected through a methodological approach . The predefined investing criteria include the inclusion in the AI 30 report .  The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF is well-positioned to capitalize on this momentum . The top five fund holdings, includingMicrosoft,Nvidia,Oracle,Broadcom, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, contribute about 25% of the total weighting . Smaller AI stocks, such asC3.ai,SoundHound AI,Innodata, andElastic NV, are also represented in the fund .  Since the fund's inception date on June 3, the ETF has returned 3.4% through June 16, compared to a 1% gain in the tech-heavy Nasdaq-100 index tracking the Invesco QQQ Trust . The fund is a great option for adding exposure to AI tech stocks without the complexity of individual stock picking . Apple is falling behind in the artificial intelligence field and the business is growing slowly . ASML and Taiwan Semiconductor can benefit from increased spending on AI computer chips . Both semiconductor-related companies are projected to grow faster than Apple this year .  Apple has released some successful ancillary products such as the Apple Watch and Air Pods, but these are not large enough to move the needle for a company with a market capitalization of $3 trillion . The iPhone is increasingly similar with each yearly update, minimal AI features have been added to its branded "Apple Intelligence" products, and the Vision Pro virtual reality headset was a flop .  The stock trades at an expensive price-to-earnings ratio (P/E) of 31 even though it is barely growing anymore . There is not much upside to owning Apple stock today versus other fast-growing technology players around the world .  ASML is a supplier to TSMC, with its advanced lithography machines used for semiconductor manufacturing . TSMC is the only company in the world to crack the code on extreme ultraviolet lithography . Last quarter, ASML's revenue grew 46% year over year to $8.38 billion . Today, you can buy the stock at a P/E ratio of 28, lower than Apple .  Lawsuits threaten Apple's services cash cow . The App Store is now being forced to open up to other payment providers that can circumvent Apple's 30% take rate on mobile purchases . These developments could greatly impact Apple's earnings power in the years to come .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is992% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Broadcom joined the trillion-dollar club late last year . The software and chip company has been riding the AI wave as companies like Alphabet and Meta place orders for its custom AI chips . Analysts expect Broadcom’s sales to soar 22% this fiscal year and 21% in 2026 .  Nvidia is the only company in the Magnificent Seven whose sales growth surpasses Broadcom’s . Tesla's market cap is just above the $1 trillion mark . Four of the seven companies have seen their shares fall this year .  Some experts say the purpose of these groupings is to track trends, not just the most valuable companies . If the trend investors are eyeing now is AI, then swapping Tesla for Broadcom may not make sense . Another option might be to simply expand the Magnificent 7 to a Magnificent 8 .

UBS has built out its podcasting program to help its advisors launch their own shows, expand their online reach and connect with younger audiences . The initiative is designed to help advisors connect with the next generation of wealth management clients . A recent report found thatevery dollar spent on podcasting may generate an additional dollar in new revenue .  UBS is the only wirehouse that lets its advisors market their businesses via podcast . The number of Americans who listened to one in the past month jumped to 158 million in 2025 from 135 million a year earlier, according to data from Backlinko .  Slater is involved with the firm’s “selfie video program,” in which advisors learn how to film themselves vertically, primarily for LinkedIn . At the height of the coronavirus pandemic, he said, the videos helped calm nervous clients .

Apple's valuation has nosedived this year as it has fallen behind its peers on next-gen technologies . The company's researchers aren't convinced that generative artificial intelligence can reason like humans . Apple has delayed some artificial intelligence features for its iPhones until next year . The business has struggled to generate much growth in recent quarters .  Researchers at Apple have been testing multiple AI reasoning models that fail as tasks become more complex . They found that the models couldn't follow steps in complex tasks and appeared to rely heavily on the familiarity of data . If Apple isn't convinced of the potential that AI possesses, that may be part of the reason it hasn't been investing as heavily in these types of technologies as other tech companies .  Apple's product sales over the six-month period ending March 29 have totaled $166.7 billion . iPhone revenue during that stretch was nearly unchanged . The company needs to be doing more in advancing its phones so they don't fall behind the competition .  Apple's stock has struggled this year, but it's still not a terribly cheap buy, trading at 31 times its trailing earnings . At that kind of multiple, investors might expect to see much more growth from the business . I believe that a discount is warranted for Apple stock, given the company's lack of innovation and growth . If you have $1,000 to invest right now, these are excellent stocks .  Amazon's e-commerce and cloud services form a potent combination . E-commerce is the largest revenue driver, totaling 38% of the company's $650 billion of trailing-12-month revenue . Amazon's operating income increased 20% year over year in the first quarter .  Buffett originally invested in Apple stock in 2016, and it's been one of Berkshire's most successful investments in its history . Even after Berkshire reduced its stake last year, Apple remains its largest investment . Apple's services business raked in $26 billion in revenue last quarter, or 28% of the company's total revenue .  Apple is a highly profitable business that generated $97 billion in net profit over the last four quarters . Analysts forecast earnings to grow at an annualized rate of 10% over the long term . The company was recently ranked the most valuable brand in the world by Brand Finance . Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is a legendary developer of consumer electronics and software . The stock has dropped 21.5% and now trades at $196.06, rattling many shareholders . Apple demonstrated elite profitability for a consumer discretionary business, boasting an average operating of 30.1%.  Apple's annualized revenue growth of 2% over the last two years was below its five-year trend . With the recent decline, the stock trades at 26.2× forward price-to-earnings (or $196.06 per share) Is now a good time to buy?  Donald Trump’s victory in the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election sent major indices to all-time highs . But stocks have retraced as investors debate the health of the economy and the potential impact of tariffs . While this leaves much uncertainty around 2025, a few companies are poised for long-term gains regardless of the political or macroeconomic climate .

Globalstar (NASDAQ:GSAT) operates a network of low-earth orbit satellites that provide voice and data communications services in remote areas where traditional cellular networks don't reach . Over the last five years, Globalstar grew its sales at an exceptional 13.6% compounded annual growth rate .  Globalstar has shown terrific cash profitability, enabling it to reinvest, return capital to investors . The company’s free cash flow margin was among the best in the business services sector . The divergence from its underwhelming operating margin stems from the add-back of non-cash charges like depreciation and stock-based compensation .  Globalstar has shown solid business quality lately, it struggled to grow profitably in the past . With the recent decline, the stock trades at 29.1× forward EV-to-EBITDA (or $23.83 per share) The outlook for 2025 is clouded by new trade policies that could impact business confidence and growth .  Stocks that made our list in 2020 include now familiar names such as Nvidia (+1,545% between March 2020 and March 2025) as well as under-the-radar businesses like Exlservice (+354% five-year return)

Wedbush analyst Dan Ives says manufacturing phones in the U.S. is a 'non-starter' for the president's family . The service will function as a mobile virtual network operator, leveraging the network infrastructure of T-Mobile .  Ives has previously pointed out the similar extra costs that Tim Cook-runApple Inc. could face to manufacture iPhones in the U.S. He said that the logistics of moving iPhone manufacturing to the US would be a “non-starter” at the current price point .  Earlier in May, President Trump threatened to impose a 25% tariff on iPhones . The same would apply to Samsung and other smartphone makers operating outside the U.S.

Apple's senior vice president of hardware technologies said as much during a speech in Belgium last month . Apple has used custom silicon in its iPhone devices since 2010, starting with the Apple A4 chip .  Apple has struggled to incorporate gen AI into its flagship devices, having largely lagged rivals such as Samsung and Google . The company made few references to its AI plans during its Worldwide Developers Conference earlier in June . Apple in 2020 switched its Mac computers to custom silicon from Intel processors .

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, 50% of small private businesses typically fail within five years . Even your best customers may eventually sour on your solutions, forcing you to pivot your business entirely . Apple is slowly ditching Qualcomm's modems in favor of its own .  Qualcomm plans to acquire Alphawave Semi, a producer of high-speed wired connectivity, chiplets, and custom silicon . Company has two different branches of business: Qualcomm CDMA Technologies (QCT) and Qualcomm Technology Licensing (QTL)  Qualcomm's pivot to data center markets may prove a good plan to recoup the lost revenue due to Apple's increasing reliance on its own modems . According to Gartner, semiconductor revenue in data centers almost doubled in 2024 to reach $112 billion .  Bank of America analyst Tal Liani and his team recently updated their opinion on Qualcomm shares . Majority of the revenue came from QCT part of the company, which had revenue of $9.5 billion . The analysts believe there are only limited near-term catalysts for the stock and lowered their estimates and price objectives .  Qualcomm's forward P/E ratio is currently 13. equal to 15 times their calendar 2026 earnings estimates . The handset market is mature and without any visible growth catalyst . Analysts concluded that AI PC and data center connectivity could contribute to growth but may take time to offset smartphone trends .  This story was originally reported by TheStreet on Jun 18, 2025, where it first appeared. appeared on TheStreet . This story has been reported by the Street on CNN.com .

Apple's senior vice president of hardware technologies made the remarks in a speech in Belgium . Johny Srouji outlined Apple's development of custom chips from the first A4 chip in an iPhone in 2010 to the most recent chips that power Mac desktop computers and Vision Pro headset .  Srouji: "EDA companies are super critical in supporting our chip design complexities" The two biggest players in the chip industry have been racing to add artificial intelligence to their offerings . Apple made no contingency plans in case the switch from Intel's chips to its own chips did not work .
